intro: Galeopsis hispida, commonly known as rough horseweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect stems covered in stiff, bristly hairs. The leaves are lance-shaped, with a rough texture and often have a slightly hairy surface. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in loose spikes and bloom from June to September. This plant is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in dry meadows.
